channel.title: Secure PHP Mailer v.03 by Ron
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt][b]Secure PHP Mailer v.03[/b][/size] by Ron[/center]
This is the PHP Mail Form I just completed today. It started out as a real quick way of emailing with just 1 page, but then got more and more complicated as I went on. I added numerous checks and security catches. I have thoroughly tested this, but I have made a few mistakes. I also tried to fully comment the entire script so that PHP newbies can understand it better and learn from it.
[b]Features[/b] * Sends an email to an email address that you specify! * If your email has not been setup, an error message will be displayed until you do. * Fully commented script so you can learn from it. * Able to call the script whatever you want as long as it ends in .php and it will still work! * Carefully secures all your text fields so that no one can inject any code such as using GET vars in lieu of POST vars. * Cleans out ampersand codes in order to stop people from creating awry characters. * Cleans out HTML >'s and <'s tags to insure there is no injection. * Makes sure no one can put anything extra into your email like extra headers to send an email to more than once person. * Able to set a max lengths to all text fields including the textarea. * Uses JavaScript to show the user how many characters left the person can use if a max length is set for the textarea field. * Writes code in perfectly validated XHTML 1.0 Transitional but purposely without the XHTML header so you could just use this as an include file! * Easy to use IP banning capabilities by using a simple text file rather than a MySQL database. * Sends the user's IP address through the Email without letting the person know that the IP was sent. * Option to show how long it took for the script to compile. * Able to send mail to hotmail.com now, but it will show up in the Junk folder.
If you want to see the code in action, click on this link, fill out the form, and I will receive the email. Test out: http://goons.freepgs.com/FUN/contactme.php Source Code: http://goons.freepgs.com/php_scripts.php?p=Secure_PHP_Mailer
*** Could not include code because it's too long, so just look at the source code link above. ***
Hope you like this script! Feel free to change this, but if you use this, please comment and thank me! :D
~Ron

[/php]
